dally.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to take too long to do something, especially to make a decision
dally.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: After months of dallying, the government has finally agreed to allow the plan to go ahead.
dally.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to spend some time in a place, on your way to somewhere else
dally.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He dallied in the Lake District for a while, then crossed to Belgium.
